intro: Polygala lensaei, commonly known as the lens-shaped milkweed, is a rare and specialized plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Polygala lensaei is considered a vulnerable species.
